title: Current COVID-19 and Vaccination Status in Chile
description: As on 31 August 2021, over a million confirmed cases and 36,937 deaths have been recorded, however, the good news is more than 70% of the population in Chile is fully vaccinated.
contents:
A short data story linked to one of the tables presented (3 marks)
• At least two tables that each follows the recommended presentation of tables in Lecture 3 (5 marks) – one table designed for user data exploration (i.e. interactive)
– one table that includes numerical summary statistics linked to the data story; this table may be static and shouldn’t be long historical – at least one table should contain title and caption that is communicating a story (i.e. directs the reader to the main aspect of table they should notice) – the look of tables should be customised to make it relevant or engaging to readers

title: Data Description
description: The dataset used in this blog is retrieved from Our World in Data on 1 Sep 2021
contents:
The dataset used for all tables, plots and analysis is retrieved from Our World in Data on 1 September 2021, with all data up to date until 31 August 2021. This dataset is publicly available and completely open access under the Creative Commons BY license, and is allowed to be used for analysis purpose of this blog.
The original dataset includes data from 233 countries, and contains 62 columns and 113313 observations in total. This blog only focus on the COVID-19 situation in Chile, and the areas of interests are only related to confirmed cases, number of tests conducted, number of death, vaccinations performed, and relevant demographics of the local population.
Data Cleaning
Therefore, the dataset has been filtered and selected with only relevant variables and observations from Chile, stored in a tidy format for analysis purpose of this report.
The filtered dataset contains 17 variables and 556 observations from Feb 2020 to Aug 2021, the description of the variables included are listed in the following section.
Variables Included
Variable
Data Type
Description
iso_code
character
Country code
location
character
Country name
date
date
Date
total_cases
double
Total confirmed cases - cumulative
new_cases
double
New confirmed cases of the day
total_deaths
double
Total death - cumulative
new_deaths
double
New death of the day
total_tests
double
Total tests conducted - cumulative
new_tests
double
New tests conducted of the day
positive_rate
double
Positive test results rate of the day
tests_per_case
double
Number of tests conducted for 1 confirmed case - daily
total_vaccinations
double
Total vaccinations performed - cumulative
new_vaccinations
double
New vaccinations performed of the day
people_vaccinated
double
Total number of people vaccinated - cumulative
people_vaccinated_per_hundred
double
Vaccinated rate per hundred people
people_fully_vaccinated
double
Total number of people fully vaccinated - cumulative
people_fully_vaccinated_per_hundred
double
Fully vaccinated rate per hundred people
Data Source Reference
Hannah Ritchie, Edouard Mathieu, Lucas Rodés-Guirao, Cameron Appel, Charlie Giattino, Esteban Ortiz-Ospina, Joe Hasell, Bobbie Macdonald, Diana Beltekian and Max Roser (2020) - “Coronavirus Pandemic (COVID-19)”. Published online at OurWorldInData.org. Retrieved from: ‘https://ourworldindata.org/coronavirus’ [Online Resource]

title: Welcome to COVID-19 in Chile
description:
Welcome to our new blog, COVID-19 in Chile. We hope you enjoy 
reading what we have to say!
contents:
COVID-19 in Chile aims to provide tables, plots and related analysis regarding the COVID-19 situation in Chile between Feb 2020 to Aug 2021.
All tables, plots and data description can be found in posts and related sections on navigation bar.
Dataset used for all analysis was retrieved from Our World in Data on 1 Sep 2021, data contained is updated until 31 Aug 2021.
